data.name: Almost prime numbers
data.description:
An integer `(>1)` is k-almost-prime if it is the product of `k` primes, as follows:
```
k   |	OEIS       | k-almost primes
-------------------------------------
1   |	A000040	| 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, ...
2   |	A001358	| 4, 6, 9, 10, 14, 15, 21, 22, ...
3   |	A014612	| 8, 12, 18, 20, 27, 28, 30, 42, 44, 45, 50, 52, ...
4   |	A014613	| 16, 24, 36, 40, 54, 56, 60, 81, 84, 88, 90, 100, ...
5   |	A014614	| 32, 48, 72, 80, 108, 112, 120, 162, 168, 176, 180, ..

For example, for k = 2, the series is as follows: 2*2, 2*3, 3*3, 2*5, etc.
```
In this Kata, you will be given `n` and `k`, and your task is to return the `n-th` number in the k-almost prime series.
```
For example, solve(n,k) => solve(4,2) = 10, because 10 is the 4th number in the k=2 series.
```
`1 <= n <= 1000` and `2 <= k <= 15`. We will only test for numbers __less than 150,000__. If a result falls outside this range or there is no `n` for that position, return `-1`.

More examples in the test cases. Good luck!

More reading at [wolfram](http://mathworld.wolfram.com/AlmostPrime.html) and [wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Almost_prime).
